awd_titl_txt: Conference on Strengthening Community in Research Mathematics
awd_abstract_narration:
The Conference on Strengthening Community in Research Mathematics will take place February 17-18, 2023 in Claremont, California.  The conference will strengthen the mathematical research community by gathering researchers in cutting-edge mathematics,  highlighting the strategic role and importance of our professional organizations, and by disseminating successful strategies to enable mathematicians from traditionally underrepresented groups to flourish. The conference will not only enhance the flow of talent into the mathematics research community but  also help upgrade the demographic reach and capabilities of the entire STEM pipeline. 

The conference will achieve its goals in several ways.  General audience research talks will be in the core fields of number theory and algebraic geometry and will be designed to facilitate future collaborations while providing a supportive environment for young mathematicians from underserved backgrounds to experience the beauty and power of number theory and algebraic geometry. We will also address relevant questions that undergraduate and graduate students have about the profession with talks and panel discussions on the graduate school admission and matriculation process, navigating the mathematical discipline as a member of a currently underrepresented group, the multitude of career opportunities that one can pursue with a graduate degree in mathematics, and managing academic and nonacademic job ladders. Faculty will in turn participate in talks and panel discussions that address mentoring students from underrepresented groups and how to engage undergraduates in their research.  For more information, visit the conference web-page 
https://www.pomona.edu/academics/departments/mathematics-statistics/events-colloquia/conference-strengthening-community-research-mathematics.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Conference on Strengthening Community in Research Mathematics was held at Pomona College on February 17-18, 2023. The conference centered on advancing research in number theory and algebraic geometry, with a dual focus on empowering researchers from historically underrepresented racial groups. Inspired by the contributions of Professor Edray Goins, the event marked a celebration of his impact, strategically aligning its themes with his work on the occasion of his fiftieth birthday. The conference's central goals were (1) to increase engagement and access to professional mathematics organizations; (2) to enhance mentoring opportunities for students from traditionally underrepresented backgrounds; and (3) to foster the cultivation and dissemination of effective mentoring resources and skills, thereby strengthening the entire mathematical community.

Keynote addresses enriched attendees' understanding of foundational mathematical questions. Additionally, a keynote focused on building a research community for social justice highlighted the societal impact of mathematical research. Tailored sessions provided students with crucial insights into problem selection and publication, setting them on a path for successful research endeavors. Panels on post-undergraduate and post-graduate options empowered early-career mathematicians to make informed decisions about their academic and professional trajectories. The conference's research talks, notably in number theory and algebraic geometry, aimed to inspire future breakthroughs in these fields.

Networking was a central focus, ensuring attendees had ample opportunities to forge meaningful connections. A dynamic networking banquet, coupled with a structured table-rotation system, facilitated diverse interactions among participants at varying stages of their careers. Mentorship was a cornerstone of the conference's success. Targeted sessions equipped faculty to create inclusive research and educational spaces, enriching the learning experience for all students. In sum, the conference was a resounding success, leaving a lasting impact on the mathematical community. It not only advanced the boundaries of mathematical knowledge but also fostered a more inclusive and supportive environment for mathematicians of all backgrounds to thrive.

Due to lingering effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, fewer people were able to travel than expected. Utilizing an approved No Cost Extension, conference organizers redirected unexpended travel funds towards follow up activities held at the Mobilizing the Power of Diversity Conference which will be held at Bryn Mawr College on October 13-14, 2023
